name: Corn
description: A tall cereal grass cultivated for its edible grains, known as kernels, which grow in rows on a cob.
variety_info: Sweet corn, field corn, popcorn. Hybrids vary in sweetness and maturity time.
attributes: Fast-growing, tall stalks, wind-pollinated, requires full sun.
disease_signs: Yellowing leaves, stunted growth, mold on kernels

name: Tomato
description: A popular fruiting plant producing red, juicy fruits used in various cuisines worldwide.
variety_info: Cherry, beefsteak, heirloom, roma. Determinate and indeterminate types.
attributes: Vining growth, requires support, prolific fruit production.
disease_signs: Blossom end rot, early blight, yellow leaves
treatment_methods: Proper watering, neem oil, copper fungicide

name: Potato
description: A root vegetable grown for its starchy tubers, a staple food in many cultures.
variety_info: Russet, Yukon Gold, Red Pontiac, Fingerling. Early and late season varieties.
attributes: Underground tubers, bushy foliage, requires hilling.
treatment_methods: Crop rotation, insecticidal soap, proper drainage

name: Bell Pepper
description: A sweet pepper variety with a mild flavor, available in green, red, yellow, and orange colors.
variety_info: California Wonder, Big Bertha, Chocolate Bell. Colors indicate ripeness stages.
attributes: Bushy growth, thick-walled fruits, sweet flavor when ripe.
growth_stage: Seedling, vegetative, flowering, fruit set, ripening
disease_signs: Blossom end rot, bacterial spot, yellow leaves
treatment_methods: Calcium supplements, copper fungicide, proper spacing

name: Chili Pepper
description: A spicy pepper variety ranging from mildly hot to extremely pungent, used for flavor and heat.
variety_info: Jalapeño, Habanero, Cayenne, Serrano. Varies in heat level and size.
attributes: Compact bushes, prolific fruiting, varying heat levels.
growth_stage: Seedling, vegetative, flowering, fruit set, ripening
disease_signs: Powdery mildew, bacterial wilt, leaf curl
treatment_methods: Neem oil, insecticidal soap, proper air circulation

name: Pumpkin
description: A large, round, orange winter squash with a thick, ribbed skin and edible flesh and seeds.
variety_info: Common varieties include Jack O'Lantern, Sugar Pie, and Atlantic Giant.
attributes: Vining growth habit, large leaves, produces both male and female flowers.
growth_stage: Seedling to flowering to fruit set.
fruit_size: Varies widely, from 2 to over 100 pounds.
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily.
watering_interval: 1 inch per week, more in extreme heat.
trimming_interval: Prune vines if space is limited.
common_pests: Squash bugs, cucumber beetles, squash vine borers.
disease_signs: Powdery mildew, downy mildew, bacterial wilt.
treatment_methods: Neem oil, row covers, proper spacing, fungicides.

name: Butternut Squash
description: A bell-shaped winter squash with tan skin, orange flesh, and a sweet, nutty flavor.
variety_info: Waltham Butternut is a popular heirloom variety.
attributes: Vining or semi-bush habit, long storage life.
growth_stage: Seedling to flowering to fruit set.
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily.
fertilizer_interval: Side-dress with compost or fertilizer when vines start to run.
treatment_methods: Row covers, insecticidal soap, proper watering.

name: Acorn Squash
description: A small, dark green, ribbed winter squash with yellow-orange flesh, shaped like an acorn.
variety_info: Table Queen is a common variety.
attributes: Bush or short-vine habit, good for smaller gardens.
plant_dimension: Vines spread 3-5 feet for bush types.
growth_stage: Seedling to flowering to fruit set.
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily.
fertilizer_interval: Fertilize at planting and again when vines begin to run.
treatment_methods: Neem oil, copper fungicide, crop rotation.

name: Zucchini
description: A summer squash with dark green skin, cylindrical shape, and mild flavor. Harvested when immature.
variety_info: Black Beauty is a standard variety.
growth_stage: Seedling to flowering to fruit set.
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily.
fertilizer_interval: Side-dress with compost or fertilizer every 3-4 weeks.
trimming_interval: Remove old, diseased leaves as needed.
common_pests: Squash bugs, cucumber beetles, squash vine borers.

name: Lettuce
description: A leafy green vegetable, often used in salads, available in many varieties like crisphead, romaine, and leaf.
variety_info: Includes Butterhead, Romaine, Iceberg, and Loose-leaf types.
growth_stage: Seedling to rosette formation to bolting.
sunlight_requirement: 4-6 hours of sun, appreciates shade in hot weather.
watering_interval: Keep soil consistently moist, water frequently.
fertilizer_interval: Light feeding with nitrogen-rich fertilizer every 2-3 weeks.
disease_signs: Bottom rot, downy mildew, tip burn.
treatment_methods: Diatomaceous earth for slugs, insecticidal soap for aphids, proper air circulation.

name: Spinach
description: A leafy green vegetable known for its tender leaves and high nutritional value, rich in iron and vitamins.
variety_info: Common varieties include Savoy, Flat-leaf, and Semi-savoy.

name: Kale
description: A hardy leafy green with curly or flat leaves, packed with vitamins and antioxidants.
variety_info: Includes Curly kale, Lacinato (Dinosaur kale), and Red Russian kale.

name: Broccoli
description: A cool-season vegetable grown for its edible flower heads and stalks.
variety_info: Common types are Calabrese, Sprouting broccoli, and Romanesco.

name: Cauliflower
description: A brassica known for its compact white head called the curd, which is the flowering part.
variety_info: Includes White, Orange, Purple, and Green varieties.
trimming_interval: Harvest when head is tight and firm

name: Carrot
description: A root vegetable, typically orange in color, known for its crisp texture and sweet flavor.
variety_info: Includes Nantes, Imperator, Chantenay, and Danvers types.

name: Onion
description: A bulb-forming vegetable with a pungent flavor, widely used in cooking.
variety_info: Common varieties include Yellow, Red, and White onions.

name: Garlic
description: A pungent bulb vegetable used for flavoring, with medicinal properties.
variety_info: Softneck and Hardneck are the main types.

name: Sweet Potato
description: A tropical vine grown for its sweet, starchy tubers.
variety_info: Common varieties include Beauregard and Jewel.

name: Cucumber
description: A creeping vine that produces cylindrical fruits, often used in salads and pickling.
variety_info: Slicing and Pickling are the main types.

name: Green Beans
description: A fast-growing vegetable producing edible pods, available in bush or pole varieties.
variety_info: Bush beans and Pole beans are the main types.
plant_dimension: Bush: 18-24 inches tall; Pole: 6-8 feet tall

name: Okra
description: A warm-season vegetable known for its edible green seed pods, often used in soups and stews.
variety_info: Common varieties include Clemson Spineless and Emerald.

name: Turnip
description: A root vegetable cultivated for its edible white root and leafy greens.
variety_info: Common varieties include Purple Top and Tokyo Cross.

name: Cabbage
description: A leafy green vegetable known for its dense-leaved heads, often used in coleslaw and salads.
variety_info: Common varieties include Green, Red, and Savoy.

name: Apple
description: A deciduous tree producing sweet, crisp fruits that are widely consumed fresh or used in cooking.
variety_info: Common varieties include Fuji, Gala, and Granny Smith.

name: Crabapple
description: A small ornamental tree known for its beautiful spring blossoms and small, often tart fruits.
variety_info: Common varieties include Prairifire and Royalty.

name: Pear
description: A deciduous tree known for its sweet, bell-shaped fruits. Pears are popular in home orchards and require cross-pollination for best fruit set.
variety_info: Common varieties include Bartlett, Anjou, and Bosc. They vary in ripening time, flavor, and storage life.
growth_stage: Dormant in winter, blooms in spring, fruits in late summer to fall
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily

name: Peach
description: A fast-growing deciduous tree prized for its juicy, fuzzy-skinned fruits. Requires winter chilling to produce fruit.
variety_info: Varieties include Elberta, Redhaven, and Georgia Belle. They are classified as freestone or clingstone.
growth_stage: Dormant in winter, blooms in early spring, fruits in summer
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily

name: Plum
description: A hardy fruit tree producing a variety of sweet to tart fruits. Many varieties require a pollinator partner.
variety_info: Includes European plums (like Stanley) and Japanese plums (like Santa Rosa). They differ in flavor and chill requirements.
growth_stage: Dormant in winter, blooms in spring, fruits in summer
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily

name: Apricot
description: A small, early-blooming tree known for its velvety-skinned, orange fruits. Blooms are susceptible to late frosts.
variety_info: Popular varieties are Moorpark, Blenheim, and Tilton. They are generally self-fruitful.
growth_stage: Dormant in winter, very early spring blooms, fruits in early summer
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily

name: Cherry
description: A beautiful flowering tree that produces clusters of small stone fruits. Comes in sweet and sour varieties.
variety_info: Sweet cherries (like Bing) and sour cherries (like Montmorency). Most sweet cherries need cross-pollination.
growth_stage: Dormant in winter, blooms in spring, fruits in early to mid-summer
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun daily

name: Blueberry
description: A perennial flowering plant with indigo-colored berries, known for their sweet and tart flavor and high antioxidant content.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Bluecrop, Jersey, and Pink Lemonade.
disease_signs: Reddish spots on leaves, stem cankers, mummified fruit.
treatment_methods: Apply fungicides, remove infected plant parts, ensure good air circulation.

name: Cranberry
description: A low-growing, trailing vine known for its tart, red berries, commonly used in sauces and juices.
variety_info: Common varieties are Stevens, Ben Lear, and Early Black.
disease_signs: Rosette growth, fruit rot, red leaves.
treatment_methods: Use approved insecticides, practice crop rotation, flood bogs for pest control.

name: Blackberry
description: A bramble fruit producing aggregate berries on thorny or thornless canes, known for their deep flavor.
variety_info: Includes Triple Crown (thornless), Apache, and Chester.
disease_signs: Orange rust on leaves, cane blight, double blossoms.
treatment_methods: Prune out old canes, apply miticides, remove and destroy infected plants.

name: Raspberry
description: A bramble fruit with delicate, hollow berries that come in red, black, purple, and yellow varieties.
variety_info: Heritage (red), Jewel (black), and Anne (yellow) are popular.
disease_signs: Crumbly fruit, yellow leaves with green veins, cane lesions.
treatment_methods: Prune fruiting canes after harvest, use row covers, apply appropriate fungicides.

name: Strawberry
description: A low-growing, herbaceous plant producing sweet, red, aromatic fruits, often grown as a perennial or annual.
variety_info: June-bearing (Honeoye), Everbearing (Ozark Beauty), and Day-neutral (Tristar).
disease_signs: Gray mold on fruit, powdery white coating on leaves, wilting plants.
treatment_methods: Use straw mulch, apply organic slug bait, remove diseased fruit and foliage.

name: Grape
description: A woody vine cultivated for its edible fruit, often used for winemaking, juice, or eating fresh.
variety_info: Common varieties include Concord, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Thompson Seedless.

name: Watermelon
description: A sprawling vine with large, juicy fruits known for their sweet, red flesh.
variety_info: Popular types are Crimson Sweet, Sugar Baby, and Charleston Gray.

name: Cantaloupe
description: A sweet, aromatic melon with netted skin and orange flesh, growing on trailing vines.
variety_info: Includes varieties like Hale's Best, Athena, and Ambrosia.

name: Avocado
description: An evergreen tree producing nutritious, creamy fruits rich in healthy fats.
variety_info: Common cultivars are Hass, Fuerte, and Bacon.

name: Orange
description: A citrus tree bearing sweet, juicy fruits rich in vitamin C.
variety_info: Includes Navel, Valencia, and Blood oranges.

name: Lemon
description: A small evergreen tree known for its bright yellow, acidic fruits used in cooking and beverages.
variety_info: Common varieties include Eureka, Lisbon, and Meyer lemons.
disease_signs: Yellow leaves, Leaf drop, Sooty mold
treatment_methods: Neem oil, Insecticidal soap, Proper watering

name: Lime
description: A citrus tree producing small, green, tangy fruits essential for culinary and cocktail uses.
variety_info: Key lime and Persian lime are popular types.

name: Papaya
description: A fast-growing tropical tree bearing large, sweet, orange-fleshed fruits.
variety_info: Solo and Mexican are common varieties.

name: Pineapple
description: A tropical plant with a rosette of sword-like leaves and a composite fruit.
variety_info: Smooth Cayenne and Red Spanish are well-known.

name: American Persimmon
description: A deciduous tree producing sweet, orange fruits after frost.
variety_info: Native species with astringent fruit until ripe.

name: Pawpaw
description: A small deciduous tree producing large, edible fruits with a tropical flavor.
variety_info: Common varieties include Sunflower, Susquehanna, and Shenandoah.

name: Elderberry
description: A fast-growing shrub known for its clusters of small, dark berries used in syrups and jams.
variety_info: Popular cultivars are Adams, York, and Nova.

name: Mulberry
description: A tree producing sweet, blackberry-like fruits that are attractive to birds and wildlife.
variety_info: Common types are Illinois Everbearing, Black Persian, and White Mulberry.
attributes: Edible Fruit, Fast Growing, Shade Tree

name: Gooseberry
description: A thorny shrub producing tart, translucent berries ideal for pies and preserves.
variety_info: Notable varieties include Hinnomaki Red, Invicta, and Pixwell.

name: Basil
description: A popular aromatic herb with a strong, sweet scent, widely used in cooking.
variety_info: Includes Genovese, Thai, Purple Ruffles, and Lemon Basil.
native: Tropical regions from central Africa to Southeast Asia

name: Mint
description: A fast-growing aromatic herb with refreshing leaves, commonly used in teas, desserts, and savory dishes.
variety_info: Peppermint
Spearmint
Chocolate Mint

name: Oregano
description: A pungent, flavorful herb essential in Mediterranean cuisine, with small green leaves and a robust aroma.
variety_info: Greek Oregano
Italian Oregano
Golden Oregano

name: Thyme
description: A low-growing herb with tiny, aromatic leaves, offering a earthy flavor perfect for meats, stews, and sauces.
variety_info: English Thyme
Lemon Thyme
Creeping Thyme

name: Rosemary
description: A woody, evergreen shrub with needle-like leaves and a strong, pine-like scent, used extensively in cooking.
variety_info: Tuscan Blue
Arp
Prostrate

name: Sage
description: A hardy perennial herb with soft, gray-green leaves, known for its savory, slightly peppery flavor.
variety_info: Common Sage
Purple Sage
Tricolor Sage

name: Cilantro
description: A fast-growing annual herb with delicate, lacy leaves and a pungent, citrusy flavor. Also known as coriander when referring to the seeds.
variety_info: Common varieties include Leisure, Santo, and Calypso.
native: Southern Europe, North Africa, Southwest Asia

name: Parsley
description: A bright green, biennial herb with either flat or curly leaves, widely used as a garnish and flavoring.
variety_info: Common types are Flat-leaf (Italian) and Curly-leaf.

name: Dill
description: An aromatic annual herb with feathery green leaves and yellow flowers. Used for its leaves and seeds.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Bouquet, Fernleaf, and Mammoth.

name: Chives
description: A perennial herb with thin, hollow, grass-like leaves and edible purple flowers. Has a mild onion flavor.
variety_info: Common Chives and Garlic Chives are the main types.
trimming_interval: Cut back to 2 inches several times per season

name: Tarragon
description: A perennial herb with narrow, aromatic leaves and a distinctive anise-like flavor. French tarragon is the culinary standard.
variety_info: French Tarragon (best flavor), Russian Tarragon (less flavorful).
watering_interval: When soil is dry to the touch

name: Marjoram
description: A fragrant herb with sweet pine and citrus flavors, commonly used in cooking.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Sweet Marjoram and Pot Marjoram.

name: Catnip
description: A perennial herb known for its stimulating effect on cats, with heart-shaped leaves and white flowers.
variety_info: Common varieties include Nepeta cataria and Citriodora.

name: Wild Bergamot
description: A native perennial with showy lavender flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
variety_info: Also known as Bee Balm, varieties include Monarda fistulosa.

name: Yarrow
description: A hardy perennial with feathery leaves and clusters of small, flat-topped flowers in various colors.
variety_info: Common varieties include Achillea millefolium and Moonshine.

name: Sunflower
description: A tall annual plant with large, bright yellow flowers that follow the sun.
variety_info: Popular varieties include Helianthus annuus and Russian Giant.

name: Black-Eyed Susan
description: A cheerful perennial with golden-yellow petals and dark brown centers that attract pollinators.
variety_info: Goldsturm
Indian Summer
Cherry Brandy

name: Coneflower
description: A hardy perennial known for its large, daisy-like flowers with raised central cones.
variety_info: Purpurea
White Swan
Magnus

name: Goldenrod
description: A vibrant perennial producing dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers.
variety_info: Solidago rugosa
Solidago canadensis
Fireworks

name: Aster
description: A fall-blooming perennial with star-shaped flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white.
variety_info: New England Aster
New York Aster
Monte Cassino

name: Columbine
description: A delicate perennial with unique, spurred flowers that nod gracefully on slender stems.
variety_info: Aquilegia canadensis
Aquilegia vulgaris
McKana Giant

name: Lupine
description: Tall, showy flower spikes in various colors, popular in cottage gardens.
variety_info: Russell Hybrids, Texas Bluebonnet
growth_stage: Seedling to flowering in one season
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun

name: Milkweed
description: Essential host plant for monarch butterflies with fragrant flower clusters.
variety_info: Common Milkweed, Swamp Milkweed, Butterfly Weed
growth_stage: Establishes in first year, flowers in second

name: Marigold
description: Bright, cheerful flowers that bloom continuously throughout summer.
variety_info: French Marigold, African Marigold, Signet Marigold
plant_dimension: Height: 6 in-3 ft, Spread: 6 in-2 ft

name: Daisy
description: Classic white-petaled flowers with yellow centers, symbolizing innocence.
variety_info: Shasta Daisy, Oxeye Daisy, English Daisy

name: Wild Rose
description: Hardy, fragrant roses with simple five-petaled flowers and rose hips.
variety_info: Rosa rugosa, Rosa virginiana, Rosa woodsii

name: Fireweed
description: A tall, showy wildflower with vibrant pinkish-purple spikes of flowers that bloom from bottom to top. It is often one of the first plants to colonize disturbed or burned areas.
variety_info: Common varieties include Chamerion angustifolium.
plant_dimension: 1.5 to 2.5 meters tall, 0.5 to 1 meter wide
growth_stage: Rapid grower, blooms in second year

name: Bluebell
description: A spring-flowering bulb known for its delicate, nodding, bell-shaped blue flowers that form dense carpets in woodland settings.
variety_info: Common species is Hyacinthoides non-scripta.
plant_dimension: 0.2 to 0.5 meters tall, 0.1 to 0.2 meters wide

name: Trillium
description: A distinctive woodland wildflower with three leaves, three petals, and three sepals. Flowers can be white, red, or yellow.
variety_info: Many species including Trillium grandiflorum (Great White Trillium).
plant_dimension: 0.2 to 0.5 meters tall, 0.2 to 0.4 meters wide
growth_stage: Slow from seed, can take years to flower

name: Violet
description: A low-growing plant with heart-shaped leaves and small, often purple, five-petaled flowers. Some varieties are fragrant.
variety_info: Includes Viola odorata (Sweet Violet) and Viola sororia (Common Blue Violet).
plant_dimension: 0.1 to 0.2 meters tall, 0.2 to 0.3 meters wide

name: Iris
description: A popular flowering plant with striking, ornate flowers that have three upright standards and three falling petals. Comes in a vast array of colors.
variety_info: Includes Bearded Iris (Iris germanica), Siberian Iris (Iris sibirica), and many others.
attributes: Showy flowers, rhizomatous or bulbous, diverse colors
plant_dimension: 0.3 to 1.2 meters tall, 0.3 to 0.6 meters wide
growth_stage: Establishes quickly, blooms in first or second year
treatment_methods: Divide crowded clumps, insecticide for borers

name: White Oak
description: A large, deciduous tree known for its strong wood and lobed leaves. It provides excellent shade and supports diverse wildlife.
variety_info: Quercus alba. Notable for its light gray, scaly bark and red fall foliage.
disease_signs: Powdery mildew on leaves, cankers on branches.
treatment_methods: Apply horticultural oil for pests; prune affected branches for disease.

name: Red Oak
description: A fast-growing oak with pointed lobes on its leaves and brilliant red fall color.
variety_info: Quercus rubra. Known for its rapid growth and tolerance of urban conditions.
disease_signs: Sudden wilting and browning of leaves, indicating Oak Wilt.
treatment_methods: Inject systemic fungicide for Oak Wilt; remove and destroy infected trees.

name: Sugar Maple
description: Famous for its brilliant orange and red fall foliage and as the primary source of maple syrup.
variety_info: Acer saccharum. Valued for its hard, dense lumber and iconic fall display.
disease_signs: Tar spots on leaves, verticillium wilt causing branch dieback.
treatment_methods: Apply insecticidal soap for aphids; prune out wilted branches.

name: Red Maple
description: A versatile and adaptable maple tree with red flowers in spring and vibrant red fall color.
variety_info: Acer rubrum. Tolerates a wide range of soils and is one of the most common native trees.
disease_signs: Leaf scorch in drought, anthracnose causing leaf spots.
treatment_methods: Ensure adequate watering; rake and destroy fallen leaves to manage anthracnose.

name: Ponderosa Pine
description: A tall pine tree with distinctive, puzzle-like bark and long needles, often smelling of vanilla.
variety_info: Pinus ponderosa. A important timber tree known for its drought tolerance.
disease_signs: Pitch tubes on trunk from beetles, needle cast diseases.
treatment_methods: Maintain tree health to resist beetles; apply fungicide for severe needle cast.

name: White Pine
description: A large, fast-growing evergreen tree with soft, flexible blue-green needles bundled in groups of five. It is a valuable timber tree and provides important wildlife habitat.
variety_info: Common varieties include Eastern White Pine (Pinus strobus).
disease_signs: Yellowing needles, resinous cankers on branches.
treatment_methods: Apply insecticidal soap for weevils; remove and destroy infected branches.

name: Lodgepole Pine
description: A slender, straight pine tree with yellowish-green needles in pairs. Its serotinous cones often require heat from fire to open and release seeds.
variety_info: Known for its adaptability to poor soils and fire-prone ecosystems.
disease_signs: Pitch tubes on trunk, red needles in the canopy.
treatment_methods: Remove infested trees; maintain tree vigor with proper watering.

name: Sitka Spruce
description: A large, fast-growing coastal conifer with sharp, stiff, blue-green needles and a narrow, conical crown. It is known for its high-quality timber.
variety_info: Thrives in cool, moist coastal environments.
disease_signs: Defoliation, webbing in branches, sooty mold.
treatment_methods: Apply Bt (Bacillus thuringiensis) for budworms; use horticultural oil for aphids.

name: White Spruce
description: A hardy, conical evergreen tree with short, stiff, bluish-green needles that have a pungent odor when crushed. It is very adaptable to cold climates.
variety_info: Includes popular dwarf cultivars like 'Densata'.
disease_signs: Swollen galls at the base of new shoots, needle discoloration.
treatment_methods: Prune out galls before they open; apply dormant oil in early spring.

name: Douglas Fir
description: A massive, iconic evergreen conifer with soft, flat needles and distinctive hanging cones that have three-pointed bracts. It is one of the world's most important timber trees.
variety_info: Includes both coastal and Rocky Mountain varieties.
disease_signs: Chewed needles, pitch tubes on the bark.
treatment_methods: Promote tree health; use insecticides for severe moth infestations.

name: Balsam Fir
description: A popular evergreen tree known for its symmetrical shape and aromatic needles, often used as a Christmas tree.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Balsam' and 'Fraser Fir'.

name: Sycamore
description: A large deciduous tree recognized by its distinctive mottled bark that peels away in patches.
variety_info: American Sycamore is the most common variety.

name: Birch
description: Elegant deciduous trees known for their distinctive white bark and delicate leaves.
variety_info: Includes Paper Birch, River Birch, and Silver Birch.

name: Aspen
description: A fast-growing deciduous tree known for its trembling leaves and smooth white bark.
variety_info: Quaking Aspen is the most widespread variety.

name: Cottonwood
description: A large, fast-growing tree known for its cotton-like seeds and preference for moist areas.
variety_info: Eastern Cottonwood and Fremont Cottonwood are common types.

name: Redwood
description: A giant, fast-growing coniferous tree known for its immense height and reddish-brown bark.
variety_info: Includes the Coast Redwood (Sequoia sempervirens) and Giant Sequoia (Sequoiadendron giganteum).

name: Sequoia
description: A massive coniferous tree, famous for its tremendous girth and longevity.
variety_info: Primarily the Giant Sequoia (Sequoiadendron giganteum).

name: Cedar
description: An aromatic evergreen tree with durable wood and a pyramidal growth habit.
variety_info: Includes Atlas Cedar, Cedar of Lebanon, and Deodar Cedar.

name: Hemlock
description: A graceful, shade-tolerant conifer with soft, flat needles and drooping branch tips.
variety_info: Includes Eastern Hemlock and Western Hemlock.
native: Eastern North America, Western North America

name: Hickory
description: A deciduous tree valued for its strong wood and edible nuts, with brilliant yellow fall color.
variety_info: Includes Shagbark Hickory, Shellbark Hickory, and Pecan.

name: Black Walnut
description: A large deciduous tree valued for its high-quality timber and edible nuts. It produces a chemical called juglone that can inhibit the growth of some other plants nearby.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Thomas' and 'Sparrow'.
treatment_methods: Apply appropriate fungicides, prune affected branches

name: Cherry Tree
description: A beautiful flowering tree that also produces delicious fruit. It is known for its spectacular spring blossom display.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Bing' (sweet) and 'Montmorency' (sour).
disease_signs: Brown rot on fruit, Leaf curl
treatment_methods: Use insecticidal soap, apply fungicides, ensure good air circulation

name: Apple Tree
description: One of the most widely cultivated fruit trees, known for its crisp and juicy apples. Requires cross-pollination for best fruit set.
variety_info: Thousands of varieties exist, such as 'Honeycrisp', 'Gala', and 'Granny Smith'.
disease_signs: Apple scab (olive-green spots on leaves), Fire blight
treatment_methods: Prune infected branches, apply dormant oil, use disease-resistant varieties

name: Magnolia
description: A majestic tree famous for its large, fragrant, and showy flowers that appear in spring. Some varieties are evergreen.
variety_info: Includes Southern Magnolia (evergreen) and Saucer Magnolia (deciduous).
treatment_methods: Horticultural oil for scales, fungicide for leaf spot

name: Dogwood
description: A popular ornamental tree known for its beautiful spring flowers, which are actually bracts surrounding small, inconspicuous true flowers.
variety_info: Flowering Dogwood (Cornus florida) is the most common.
attributes: Ornamental, Showy Bracts, Berries for Birds
disease_signs: Dogwood anthracnose (leaf spots and twig dieback), Powdery mildew
treatment_methods: Prune out infected branches, improve air circulation, apply fungicide if severe

name: Juniper
description: An evergreen coniferous shrub with needle-like or scale-like foliage, known for its hardiness and aromatic wood.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Blue Star', 'Skyrocket', and 'Wichita Blue'.
plant_dimension: Varies by variety, typically 1-15 feet tall and wide.
disease_signs: Brown or yellowing foliage, tip blight, root rot.
treatment_methods: Apply horticultural oil for pests; improve drainage and use fungicide for diseases.

name: Rhododendron
description: A popular flowering shrub with large, showy blooms and glossy, evergreen leaves.
variety_info: Popular cultivars are 'Nova Zembla', 'PJM', and 'Roseum Elegans'.
soil_type: Moist, well-drained, high in organic matter
disease_signs: Leaf spots, powdery mildew, root rot.
treatment_methods: Use insecticidal soap for pests; apply fungicide and ensure good air circulation.

name: Azalea
description: A type of rhododendron known for its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom profusely in spring.
variety_info: Common types include 'Encore', 'Girard', and 'Hino-Crimson'.
disease_signs: Petal blight, leaf gall, powdery mildew.
treatment_methods: Prune affected areas; use appropriate pesticides and fungicides.

name: Mountain Laurel
description: A broadleaf evergreen shrub native to eastern North America, prized for its unique, star-shaped flowers.
variety_info: Cultivars include 'Olympic Fire', 'Elf', and 'Sarah'.
treatment_methods: Improve air circulation; apply horticultural oil or fungicide as needed.

name: Elderberry Shrub
description: A fast-growing deciduous shrub known for its clusters of creamy white flowers and dark purple berries used in jams and syrups.
variety_info: Common varieties are 'Adams', 'Johns', 'Nova', and 'York'.
treatment_methods: Prune out canes with borers; use insecticidal soap or neem oil for pests.

name: Blueberry Shrub
description: A deciduous shrub known for its delicious blue berries and vibrant fall foliage.
variety_info: Popular varieties include 'Bluecrop' and 'Jersey'.

name: Manzanita
description: An evergreen shrub or small tree with distinctive smooth red bark and urn-shaped flowers.
variety_info: Common species include Arctostaphylos densiflora.

name: Sagebrush
description: A fragrant, silvery-gray shrub that is highly drought-tolerant and common in arid regions.
variety_info: Artemisia tridentata is the most widespread species.

name: Sumac
description: A hardy shrub known for its brilliant red fall foliage and conical clusters of red berries.
variety_info: Rhus glabra and Rhus typhina are common.

name: Gooseberry Shrub
description: A thorny shrub producing tart, edible berries, often used in jams and desserts.
variety_info: Ribes uva-crispa is a common species.

name: Snowberry
description: A deciduous shrub known for its clusters of white, waxy berries that persist through winter, providing food for birds.
variety_info: Common varieties include Symphoricarpos albus (Common Snowberry) and Symphoricarpos orbiculatus (Coralberry).

name: Agave
description: A rosette-forming succulent with thick, fleshy leaves often ending in a sharp spine. Known for its dramatic form and infrequent, towering flower stalks.
variety_info: Popular species include Agave americana (Century Plant) and Agave tequilana (Blue Agave).
plant_dimension: 1-6 feet tall and wide, varies by species

name: Aloe
description: A stemless or short-stemmed succulent with thick, fleshy leaves that contain a soothing gel, commonly used for minor burns and skin irritations.
variety_info: Aloe vera is the most common species, but there are hundreds of varieties like Aloe aristata (Lace Aloe).

name: Prickly Pear Cactus
description: A flat-stemmed cactus with large, paddle-shaped cladodes covered in spines. It produces edible fruits called tunas and colorful flowers.
variety_info: Opuntia ficus-indica is a common edible species. Opuntia humifusa is a cold-hardy variety.
plant_dimension: 3-15 feet tall and wide, varies by species

name: Saguaro Cactus
description: A giant, tree-like cactus native to the Sonoran Desert, iconic for its tall, ribbed structure and arms. It is a slow-growing and long-lived plant.
variety_info: Carnegiea gigantea is the sole species in its genus.
plant_dimension: 40-60 feet tall, up to 25 feet wide

name: Barrel Cactus
description: A round, ribbed cactus with prominent spines, known for its drought tolerance and barrel-like shape.
variety_info: Golden Barrel Cactus
Fishhook Barrel Cactus

name: Yucca
description: A perennial shrub with sword-shaped leaves and tall flower spikes, highly adaptable to arid conditions.
variety_info: Adam's Needle
Spanish Dagger
Soaptree Yucca

name: Sedum
description: A diverse genus of succulent plants with fleshy leaves and star-shaped flowers, excellent for ground cover.
variety_info: Stonecrop
Autumn Joy
Dragon's Blood

name: Echeveria
description: Rosette-forming succulents with colorful, fleshy leaves, popular in containers and rock gardens.
variety_info: Echeveria elegans
Echeveria 'Perle von Nurnberg'
Echeveria 'Lola'

name: Century Plant
description: A large agave species with a dramatic flower spike that blooms once after many years, then dies.
variety_info: Agave americana
Variegated Century Plant

name: Buffalo Grass
description: A warm-season, drought-tolerant grass native to the North American prairies, known for its fine texture and low-growing habit.
variety_info: Commonly used for low-maintenance lawns and erosion control.

name: Blue Grama
description: A hardy, warm-season grass recognized by its distinctive eyelash-shaped seed heads, thriving in arid conditions.
variety_info: Excellent for ornamental use and native landscaping.

name: Big Bluestem
description: A tall, dominant prairie grass with blue-green stems that turn reddish-bronze in the fall, providing excellent wildlife habitat.
variety_info: Often called 'turkey foot' due to its three-parted seed head.

name: Little Bluestem
description: A versatile, clump-forming grass with fine-textured blue-green foliage that turns a striking copper-red in autumn.
variety_info: Popular in ornamental grass plantings and restoration projects.

name: Switchgrass
description: A robust, rhizomatous grass with airy seed panicles, valued for biofuel production, erosion control, and as a landscape ornamental.
variety_info: Comes in many cultivars with varying heights and colors.

name: Wheat
description: A cereal grain widely cultivated for its seed, a worldwide staple food.
variety_info: Common varieties include Hard Red Winter, Soft Red Winter, and Durum.

name: Barley
description: A major cereal grain, used as a base for malt and animal fodder.
variety_info: Two-row and six-row barley are common types.

name: Oats
description: A cereal grain known for its edible seeds and use as a cover crop.
variety_info: Common types include Common Oats and Red Oats.

name: Wild Rye
description: A perennial grass often used for erosion control and as forage.
variety_info: Includes Canada Wild Rye and Virginia Wild Rye.

name: Morel
description: A highly prized edible mushroom with a distinctive honeycomb appearance.
variety_info: Includes Yellow Morel, Black Morel, and Half-Free Morel.

name: Chanterelle
description: A prized wild mushroom known for its vibrant yellow-orange color, fruity aroma, and delicate, peppery flavor. It forms a symbiotic relationship with tree roots.
variety_info: Common varieties include Golden Chanterelle (Cantharellus cibarius) and Cinnabar Red Chanterelle (Cantharellus cinnabarinus).
treatment_methods: Improve air circulation, remove affected specimens

name: Oyster Mushroom
description: A fast-growing, edible mushroom with a mild, anise-like flavor and a shelf-like appearance. Commonly cultivated on straw or hardwood logs.
variety_info: Includes Pearl Oyster (Pleurotus ostreatus), Blue Oyster (Pleurotus columbinus), and Golden Oyster (Pleurotus citrinopileatus).

name: Hen-of-the-Woods
description: Also known as Maitake, this mushroom grows in large, overlapping brown clusters at the base of trees, resembling the fluffed feathers of a nesting hen. Valued for its rich, earthy flavor.
variety_info: Primarily Grifola frondosa. No significant cultivated varieties, but wild specimens vary in size and color intensity.
soil_type: Base of oak trees, rich organic matter
trimming_interval: Harvest by cutting at the base
treatment_methods: Harvest before over-maturity, clean growing area

name: Porcini
description: A highly sought-after wild mushroom, also called King Bolete, with a thick white stem, brown cap, and a nutty, meaty flavor. It forms mycorrhizal associations with trees.
variety_info: Boletus edulis is the primary species. Regional variations exist in size and cap color.
soil_type: Well-drained, acidic soil under conifers or hardwoods
watering_interval: Depends on rainfall and soil moisture
trimming_interval: Harvest by twisting gently from base
disease_signs: Spongy texture, maggot holes, rapid decay
treatment_methods: Harvest young, inspect thoroughly, dry for preservation

name: Lion's Mane
description: A unique mushroom with long, dangling, white spines, resembling a lion's mane. It has a seafood-like flavor, often compared to crab or lobster, and is noted for its potential cognitive benefits.
variety_info: Hericium erinaceus is the most common. Other species like Hericium coralloides have a more coral-like form.
soil_type: Hardwood logs or supplemented sawdust blocks
trimming_interval: Harvest before spines yellow or brown
disease_signs: Browning spines, lack of growth, mold
treatment_methods: Increase fresh air exchange, maintain high humidity

name: Daylily
description: A hardy perennial with vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically last only one day.
variety_info: Many cultivars available in various colors including yellow, orange, red, and pink.
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun

name: Hosta
description: Shade-loving perennial known for its attractive foliage in various shades of green, blue, and variegated patterns.
variety_info: Over 70 species with thousands of cultivars, varying in leaf size, color, and texture.
plant_dimension: 6 inches to 3 feet tall, 1-6 feet wide

name: Peony
description: Long-lived perennial prized for its large, fragrant blooms in spring and early summer.
variety_info: Herbaceous and tree peonies available in single, semi-double, and double flower forms.

name: Coneflower
description: Drought-tolerant perennial with daisy-like flowers featuring raised central cones.
variety_info: Purple coneflower is most common, but cultivars available in white, yellow, orange, and red.
treatment_methods: Apply insecticidal soap, remove infected plants

name: Black-Eyed Susan
description: Cheerful wildflower with golden-yellow petals and dark brown central cones.
variety_info: Both annual and perennial varieties available, with some cultivars featuring different petal colors.

name: Phlox
description: A popular garden plant known for its clusters of fragrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, purple, white, and red.
variety_info: Common varieties include Garden Phlox (Phlox paniculata) and Creeping Phlox (Phlox subulata).
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun

name: Lavender
description: A fragrant herb with silvery-green foliage and spikes of purple flowers, widely used for its scent and medicinal properties.
variety_info: Popular types include English Lavender (Lavandula angustifolia) and French Lavender (Lavandula stoechas).

name: Marigold
description: Brightly colored flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, known for their pest-repelling properties and easy care.
variety_info: Includes African Marigolds (Tagetes erecta) and French Marigolds (Tagetes patula).
sunlight_requirement: At least 6 hours of direct sun
treatment_methods: Remove affected parts, improve air flow

name: Petunia
description: Popular bedding plants with trumpet-shaped flowers available in almost every color, known for their prolific blooming.
variety_info: Includes Grandiflora, Multiflora, and Wave (spreading) types.
plant_dimension: 6-18 inches tall, spreading up to 4 feet

name: Impatiens
description: Shade-loving plants with bright, flat-faced flowers that come in many colors, ideal for adding color to shady areas.
variety_info: Includes Impatiens walleriana and New Guinea Impatiens.
treatment_methods: Improve air circulation, use resistant varieties

name: Zinnia
description: A vibrant and popular annual flower known for its bright, daisy-like blooms that attract butterflies. Easy to grow from seed and excellent for cutting gardens.
variety_info: Common varieties include 'Benary's Giant', 'Profusion', and 'Zahara'. They come in a wide range of colors including pink, red, yellow, orange, and white.

name: Snapdragon
description: A classic cool-season annual with distinctive, dragon-shaped flowers that 'snap' open when squeezed. Available in a wide range of colors and heights.
variety_info: Types include dwarf, intermediate, and tall varieties. Popular series are 'Rocket', 'Madame Butterfly', and 'Sonnet'.
plant_dimension: 6-36 inches tall and 6-12 inches wide depending on variety
